climbs.name: Sundowning
climbs.fa: Greg Hand, Kent Lugbill, Susan Schima, Moe Hershoff

content.description:
From path, left of

Grampa's Day Out

, boulder up 15 feet to a ledge. Follow 4 bolts on the left side of the headwall to anchors.
content.protection:
4 bolts to 2-bolt anchor, shared with

Grampa's Day Out

.
content.location:
Start left of

Grampa's Day Out

.

content.description: On the middle tier. Go left from the lower tier (bouldering wall) and reach the middle rock. Sponge Bath climbs the slab and then the handcrack on the left up a steep face past two bolts.
content.protection: Gold and blue Camalots plus quickdraws will get you to a two-bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Lost Dentures
climbs.fa: Kent Lugbill, Greg Hand and Bob D'Antonio

content.description: On the lower tier. Start at a obvious flake in the center of the rock. Climb the flake (or climb the thin crack on the left 5.10). Veer left then straight up thin seams/cracks to the anchor.

climbs.name: Hip Replacement
climbs.fa: Bob D'Antonio, Greg Hand and Kent Lugbill

content.description:
Start on the the same flake for

Lost Dentures

. Stick clip the first bolt and reach right to a small layaway. Crank to a good bucket and then follow the bolts to the anchor.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Grampa's Day Out
climbs.fa: Grampa Greg, Kent Lugbill, Susan Schima, Moe Hershoff

content.description: From path, boulder up 15 feet to a ledge. Follow 4 bolts on the right side of the headwall to anchors.
content.location:
It is 20 feet left of

Aricept

.

content.description:
Just right of the approach path is a steep smooth wall with an obvious left-leaning seam. Stand start with a long move to a poor crimp at the top of the next seam, up to another bad crimp, move left to a good edge, hold the swing and jump or down climb left.

This was likely first done by Jay Droeger and rated V8 then flashed by Tyler Landman and graded V11. Consensus is at V10, but if you're short you may have issues getting the first move down.
content.protection: A few pads and spotters--it may be best to wait for winter when a healthy bank of snow can offset the slope below.
content.location: Lower tier center, just right of a wide groove/crack system.

content.description:
This is the name of the illness given to my mother before she died a month ago.

It is harder than it looks. It has interesting moves getting over the overhang.
content.location:
This is on the upper level about 50 feet right of

Angel of Mercy

.

Using these anchors, you can actually reach the lower ground with a 60m rope.

climbs.name: Elder Abuse
climbs.fa: Bob D'Antonio, Dan Brockway and Greg Hand

content.description: A hard thin crack start leads to a nice handcrack.
content.protection: Gear to a gold Camalot and single bolt.
content.location: Start as for "Sponge Bath". Climb the overhanging, thin crack on the left side of the wall.

content.description:
Clip the bolt on

Elder Abuse

and traverse right, following a finger crack on a ledge, to joint

Sponge Bath

at the first bolt. Follow

Sponge Bath

to the anchors.
content.protection:
Gear as for

Elder Abuse

plus some finger size cams for the traverse to

Sponge Bath

.

content.description:
Although short, this climb has good moves on steep rock. Follow laybacks past 3 bolts to the anchors. The crux is at the 3rd bolt. Climb this first and then lower to the ledge at the start of

Angel of Mercy

and do that climb.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor. A #3 Friend can be used for the belay at the base of the climb.
content.location:
It is left of

Angel of Mercy

. This can be approached from the base of

Angel of Mercy

or by traversing in from the top of the cliff from left of the climb. The traverse is easy, but it is probably not "dog friendly".

content.description: Start as for Sponge Bath. Climb the slab, clip the first bolt and then climb straight up to a short corner past a bolt to the anchor.
content.protection: Small gear and a couple of quickdraws will get you to the anchor.

content.description: Start on the left side of the lower tier. Climb the black overhanging flare making hard moves past the first bolt. Clip the second bolt then continue straight up on good hold passing two more bolts getting to the anchor.
content.protection: Four bolts and a two-bolt anchor.

content.description: On the upper tier of the rock is a severly overhanging west face. Angel of Mercy climbs that face.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor.
